scheme.name: aaas
scheme.description: Secure equivalent of the aaa Diameter protocol

scheme.name: acap
scheme.notes: URL scheme used within the ACAP protocol for the "subdataset" attribute, referrals and inheritance

scheme.name: cap
scheme.notes: URL scheme used to designate both calendar stores and calendars accessible using the CAP protocol

scheme.name: cid
scheme.description: Referencing individual parts of an SMTP/MIME message
scheme.notes: e.g. referencing an attached image within a formatted e-mail. (See also mid:)

scheme.name: crid
scheme.notes: Allow references to scheduled publications of broadcast media content.

scheme.name: data
scheme.description: Inclusion of small data items inline

scheme.name: dav
scheme.notes: Used for internal identifiers only; WebDAV itself addresses resources using the http: and https: schemes

scheme.name: dict
scheme.notes: refer to definitions or word lists available using the DICT protocol

scheme.name: dns
scheme.notes: designates a DNS resource record set, referenced by domain name, class, type, and, optionally, the authority

scheme.name: fax
scheme.notes: Seems to be deprecated in RFC 3966 in favour of tel:

scheme.name: file
scheme.description: Addressing files on local or network file systems
scheme.notes: Since this usually used for local files the host from RFC 1738 is often empty leading to a starting triple /. RFC 3986 allows an absolute path with no host part.

scheme.name: geo
scheme.description: A Uniform Resource Identifier for Geographic Locations
scheme.notes: Other coordinate reference systems (including those for non-terrestrial globes, such as The Moon and Mars) will be supported, once registered.

scheme.name: http
scheme.notes: RFC 2616 makes RFC 2068 obsolete.

scheme.name: im
scheme.notes: Works as xmpp: URI for single user chat sessions.

scheme.name: info
scheme.description: Information assets with identifiers in public namespaces

scheme.name: mailto
scheme.description: SMTP e-mail addresses and default content
scheme.notes: Headers are optional, but often include subject=; body= can be used to pre-fill the body of the message.

scheme.name: mid
scheme.description: Referencing SMTP/MIME messages, or parts of messages
scheme.notes: See also cid:

scheme.name: modem
scheme.notes: Seems to be deprecated in RFC 3966 in favour of tel:

scheme.name: news
scheme.notes: References a particular resource, regardless of location.

scheme.name: nntp
scheme.notes: Referencing a specific host is often less useful than referencing the resource generically, as NNTP servers are not always publicly accessible

scheme.name: pres
scheme.description: Used in Common Profile for Presence (CPP) to identify presence
scheme.notes: Similar to mailto:

scheme.name: prospero
scheme.notes: Listed as "historical" by IANA.

scheme.name: shttp
scheme.notes: Largely superseded by HTTPS.

scheme.name: sms
scheme.description: Interact with SMS capable devices for composing and sending messages
scheme.notes: Should be used as a subset of the tel: schema.

scheme.name: tag
scheme.notes: Represented entities do not necessarily have to be accessible electronically.

scheme.name: wais
scheme.description: Used with Wide area information server (WAIS)
scheme.notes: Listed as "historical" by IANA.

scheme.name: about
scheme.description: Display product information and internal information
scheme.example: See about URI scheme for more details.
scheme.notes: Widely used by web browsers, sometimes even providing interactive resources. The Opera web browser uses opera: instead.

scheme.name: aim
scheme.notes: Functions include goim, addbuddy, and buddyicon

scheme.name: apt
scheme.description: Experimental method of installing software using APT
scheme.notes: Commonly found on websites which contain Debian software repositories.

scheme.name: afp
scheme.example: over TCP/IP: afp://[<user>@]<host>[:<port>][/[<path>]] over AppleTalk: afp:/at/[<user>@]<host>[:<zone>][/]

scheme.name: aw
scheme.description: Link to an Active Worlds world
scheme.notes: Mostly found in HTTP referers when users open a website from within a Active Worlds world.

scheme.name: bitcoin
scheme.description: Send money to a bitcoin address

scheme.name: bolo
scheme.notes: Mostly passed via IRC or via tracker servers.

scheme.name: callto
scheme.notes: Introduced with Microsoft NetMeeting. Works with current version of Skype with Firefox, Internet Explorer and Safari

scheme.name: chrome
scheme.description: Specifies user interfaces built using XUL in Mozilla-based browsers
scheme.notes: Works only in Mozilla-based browsers such as Firefox, SeaMonkey and Netscape. Not related to the Google Chrome browser.

scheme.name: coap
scheme.notes: Identify CoAP resources and provide a means of locating the resource.

scheme.name: content
scheme.notes: Performs a query on an Android Content Provider

scheme.name: cvs
scheme.description: Provides a link to a Concurrent Versions System (CVS) repository

scheme.name: doi
scheme.description: Digital object identifier, for any object of intellectual property
scheme.notes: Used e.g. for most scientific publications. Can be resolved via HTTP (transormed into an URL) by prepending http://dx.doi.org/ or http://hdl.handle.net/ in front

scheme.name: ed2k
scheme.description: Resources available using the eDonkey2000 network
scheme.example: ed2k://|file|<filename>|<size of file>|<hash of file>|/ or ed2k://|server|<host>|<port>|/
scheme.notes: Links to servers are also possible, as are additional parameters. Official documentation from eDonkey2000 website at the Wayback Machine.

scheme.name: Facetime
scheme.notes: FaceTime is a video conferencing software developed by Apple for iPhone 4, the fourth generation iPod Touch, and computers running Mac OS X. Apple has not published documentation on this protocol yet.

scheme.name: feed
scheme.notes: See Feed URI scheme for a detailed overview of common implementations, supported software, and critics.

scheme.name: finger
scheme.description: Querying user information using the finger protocol

scheme.name: fish
scheme.description: Accessing another computer's files using the SSH protocol
scheme.notes: See Files transferred over shell protocol for details about the protocol.

scheme.name: git
scheme.description: Provides a link to a GIT repository

scheme.name: gizmoproject
scheme.notes: May use sip:// instead of gizmoproject:// in recent versions of Gizmo5.

scheme.name: gtalk
scheme.description: Starts a chat with a Google Talk user

scheme.name: irc
scheme.description: Connecting to an Internet Relay Chat server to join a channel
scheme.notes: Assuming the client knows a server associated with the name, "host" may optionally be an IRC network name.

scheme.name: ircs
scheme.description: Connecting to a Secured Internet Relay Chat server to join a channel
scheme.notes: Assuming the client knows a server associated with the name, "host" may optionally be an IRC network name.

scheme.name: irc6
scheme.description: Connecting to an IPV6 Internet Relay Chat server to join a channel
scheme.notes: Assuming the client knows a server associated with the name, "host" may optionally be an IRC network name.

scheme.name: itms
scheme.description: Used for connecting to the iTunes Music Store

scheme.name: jar
scheme.notes: Works for any ZIP-based file.

scheme.name: javascript
scheme.notes: Works in any modern browser.

scheme.name: lastfm
scheme.description: Connecting to a radio stream from Last FM

scheme.name: ldaps
scheme.notes: Not an IETF standard, but commonly used in applications.

scheme.name: magnet
scheme.example: magnet:?xt=urn:sha1:<hash of file>&dn=<display name> (other parameters are also possible)
scheme.notes: Used by various peer-to-peer clients, usually providing the hash of a file to be located on the network.

scheme.name: maps
scheme.notes: Some mobile web browsers will launch a dedicated mapping application. See also "geo:" (RFC 5870)

scheme.name: market
scheme.notes: Supported by Android devices.

scheme.name: message
scheme.description: Direct link to specific email message
scheme.notes: Supported by Mail since OS X 10.5

scheme.name: mms
scheme.notes: Used by Windows Media Player to stream audio and/or video.

scheme.name: msnim
scheme.description: Adding a contact or starting a conversation in Windows Live Messenger
scheme.example: Add a contact to the buddy list msnim:add?contact=nada@example.com Start a conversation with a contact msnim:chat?contact=nada@example.com Start a voice conversation with a contact msnim:voice?contact=nada@example.com Start a video conversation with a contact msnim:video?contact=nada@example.com
scheme.notes: Can be invoked from a web page or via a run command or an Internet Explorer browser URL (won't work with Firefox 2.0.0.8). For web pages use this HTML: Click to chat!

scheme.name: notes
scheme.description: Opens a Lotus Notes document or database
scheme.notes: Used by IBM Lotus Notes to refer to documents and databases stored within the Lotus Notes system. When clicked in a browser on a computer with Lotus Notes client installed, Notes will open the document link as if a Notes DocLink were clicked within Notes.

scheme.name: palm
scheme.description: Access system services in HP webOS applications

scheme.name: paparazzi
scheme.description: Launches and takes a screen shot using the Mac Paparazzi! application

scheme.name: psyc
scheme.description: Identify/locate a person, group, place or service and specify its ability to communicate

scheme.name: rmi
scheme.description: Look up a Java object in an RMI registry
scheme.notes: URI scheme understood by JNDI. Can be used to lookup a remote Java object within an RMI registry (typically for the purposes of RMI on that object). Host/port in the URI are of the rmiregistry process, not the remote object.

scheme.name: rtmp
scheme.notes: URI schema used to connect to Adobe Flash Media Server.

scheme.name: secondlife
scheme.description: Open the Map floater in Second Life application to teleport the resident to the location
scheme.notes: Used by SLurl.com.

scheme.name: skype
scheme.notes: Unofficial scheme. See also callto:

scheme.name: spotify
scheme.description: Load a track, album, artist, search or playlist in Spotify
scheme.example:
spotify:<artist|album|track>:<id> or spotify:search:<text> or spotify:user:<username>:playlist:<id>
example : spotify:track:2jCnn1QPQ3E8ExtLe6INsx

scheme.name: sftp
scheme.notes: The SFTP file transfer protocol is not to be confused with FTPS (FTP/SSL).

scheme.name: steam
scheme.description: Interacts with Steam ; install applications, purchase/run games, etc.
scheme.example: steam:<command line arguments> or steam://<action>/<id, addon, IP, hostname, etc.>

scheme.name: svn
scheme.description: Provides a link to a Subversion source control repository

scheme.name: things
scheme.notes: Provided that the Things software from Cultured Code is installed.

scheme.name: udp
scheme.description: BitTorrent tracker protocol based on UDP

scheme.name: unreal
scheme.notes: Unreal legacy protocol.

scheme.name: view-source
scheme.description: Shows a web page as code 'in the raw'
scheme.example:
view-source:<absolute-URI> where <absolute-URI> is specified in RFC 3986.
Example: view-source:http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/URI_scheme

scheme.name: webcal
scheme.description: Subscribing to calendars in iCalendar format

scheme.name: wyciwig
scheme.description: What You Cache Is What You Get

scheme.name: xfire
scheme.description: Adding friends and servers, joining servers, changing status text.

scheme.name: ymsgr
scheme.description: Sending an instant message to a Yahoo Contact
